intro: Uraspermum aristatum var. villicaule, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to certain regions of North America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
